intro: Aristida subulata, commonly known as the slender dropseed, is a perennial grass native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its fine, needle-like leaves and compact, tufted growth habit. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its small, spike-like inflorescences produce numerous tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Aristida subulata is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental appeal.
